intro: Amellus abyssinicus, commonly known as the Abyssinian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
